A few days back, I chatted with my seatmate on a long flight from Seattle to Miami. She let me know she recently joined the ranks of plasma donor. During the six-hour flight, she shared the dual benefits she uncovered. Alex began donating plasma partly out of curiosity and partly due to a friend's recommendation. The process, she discovered, was straightforward and relatively pain-free. During each session, she found solace in knowing she contributed to a cause bigger than herself, helping countless individuals needing plasma-derived treatments. Beyond the fulfilling experience, Alex highlighted an aspect many might overlook: the financial incentives. As a college student, every bit helps, and her compensation for each donation goes a long way in covering her textbooks and even some weekend treats. It's a win-win: making a difference while receiving a monetary reward. Plasma donation offers a unique blend of personal satisfaction coupled with tangible benefits. If you're seeking a way to positively impact lives while giving your wallet a little boost, consider donating plasma as Alex did. You might discover that doing good can sometimes mean doing well for yourself. #PlasmaDonation #DualBenefits #MakeADifference #EarnWhileYouHelp https://proesisbio.com/

42nd donation. A marathon distance (42 kilometers in a marathon) in blood donation. My first attempt in donating plasma. The process took 60 minutes - as opposed to 10 minutes for whole blood. Next time you visit a blood bank, check what's more impactful for your blood group and what's more needed by hospitals in your area. While whole blood donation is easier, other types are more impactful and useful. The next one I plan to attempt is donating platelets; it takes roughly 2 hours! Donate blood, save lives, and enjoy making meaning!
